content:
The provided code chunk implements special methods (`__delslice__`, `__iadd__`, and `__add__`) within a class context. These methods allow instances of the class (likely a subclass of `MetaInterval` such as `Sequence`, `Parallel`, or `Track`) to support slice deletion, in-place addition, and concatenation of interval components, enabling dynamic modification and combination of interval structures for building complex timelines.

Context: This code is part of a class that manages collections of intervals, providing functionalities to modify the sequence of intervals by deleting slices and adding new intervals either in place or through concatenation.

def __delslice__(self, i, j):
        if isinstance(self.ivals, tuple):
            self.ivals = list(self.ivals)
        del self.ivals[i: j]
        self.__ivalsDirty = 1

    def __iadd__(self, other):
        if isinstance(self.ivals, tuple):
            self.ivals = list(self.ivals)
        if isinstance(other, MetaInterval):
            assert self.__class__ == other.__class__
            ivals = other.ivals
        else:
            ivals = list(other)
        self.ivals += ivals
        self.__ivalsDirty = 1
        assert self.validateComponents(ivals)
        return self

    def __add__(self, other):
        copy = self[:]
        copy += other
        return copy
